Articles.Content:
Whenever I attempt to download version 1.0.4 via Google Chrome, it gives an error which says: "ksp-win-1-0-4.zip may harm your browsing experience, so Chrome has blocked it." over the download tab at the bottom. How do I get this to download properly?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T15:22:02Z" title="06/24/2015 03:22  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Bioman222**

It probably has downloaded properly just Chrome is being silly. Try just opening your "Downloads" folder directly (open any file explorer window and click Downloads in the left pane) and it should be there.

> 
> It probably has downloaded properly just Chrome is being silly. Try just opening your "Downloads" folder directly (open any file explorer window and click Downloads in the left pane) and it should be there.

Ctrl + J will open the Downloads Tab in Chrome as well...from there you should be able to manage the file or re-download if Chrome has actually blocked it I believe.

Google is evil, didn't you know?

They're probably just doing it to annoy you. Either that or it's another idiotic "users are stupid" feature...

I had the same thing happen. After the download was complete I got the "GC blocked it" message. I just went to the Downloads page and told it "Yes I really DO want it..." and it popped up another warning, but did un-hide it to my downloads folder.

That did it. Thanks guys!

Also, when I get to it, do I get a celebration for my 1000th post? Or maybe even a klondike bar?
